small_body.name: Asteroid (C-Type)
small_body.description: A dark, carbon-rich asteroid. Primitive and volatile-rich. Low density.
small_body.gmNotes: Source of water, carbon, and organic compounds. Very common.

small_body.name: Asteroid (M-Type)
small_body.description: A dense, metallic asteroid composed largely of nickel-iron. Likely the core of a shattered protoplanet.
small_body.gmNotes: High value mining target. Iron, Nickel, Platinum group metals. Magnetic.

small_body.name: Comet (Active)
small_body.description: A dirty snowball venting gas and dust as it approaches the sun. Surrounded by a coma.
small_body.gmNotes: Dynamic environment. Jets of gas can be hazardous. Low gravity.

small_body.name: Captured Rock (Moonlet)
small_body.description: A small, irregular rock captured into orbit. Likely a wayward asteroid.
small_body.gmNotes: Good location for a pirate base or hidden cache. Hard to spot.

station.name: International Space Station
station.description: The premier research facility in LEO. A modular habitation of modules and trusses.

station.name: Tiangong Station
station.description: A T-shaped modular station. Modern, automated, and efficient.
station.gmNotes: China's space station. Uses Gridded Ion Thrusters for station keeping.

station.name: Lunar Gateway
station.description: A small station in a Near-Rectilinear Halo Orbit around the Moon. Staging point for surface landings.
station.gmNotes: The bridge to the surface. High radiation environment outside.

station.name: Prospero's Dream
station.description: A sprawling, chaotic pirate haven and neutral port, Prospero's Dream is an artificial habitat with a diameter of 12.98 kilometers and a circumference of 40.77 kilometers. It features 23 decks in its outer ring, an average of 78 decks in its ring structures, and a towering 430-deck center spire. An artificial gravity generator provides simulated gravity.
station.gmNotes: The primary hub for Mothership campaigns. A wretched hive of scum and villainy with an estimated city-level population of ~5.6 million, though at choke points, it can reach ~3.1 million. High crime, high opportunity. Run by rival pirate lords, where anything can be bought or sold.

station.name: Orbital Research Outpost
station.description: A small, rotating habitation module designed for long-term scientific observation of a planetary body. Includes sensor arrays and a small centrifuge for gravity.
station.gmNotes: Ideal for monitoring a primitive species or studying a gas giant. Vulnerable and lightly armed.

station.name: Orbital Trade Hub
station.description: A bustling, rotating station in a key orbital position, serving as a primary market and refueling depot for system traffic. Spin gravity is ~0.8G.
station.gmNotes: A central location for quests, trade, and faction interactions. A good 'home base' for a campaign.

station.name: Ceres Station
station.description: The capital of the Belt. A dwarf planet hollowed out and spun up to provide 0.3G gravity at the outer tunnels.
station.gmNotes: Home to 6 million Belters. The Docks, Medina District, Star Helix Police HQ. 'Down' is toward the surface.

station.name: Eros Station
station.description: An elongated asteroid spun for gravity. A hub for gambling, vice, and illicit trade.
station.gmNotes: The 'Vegas' of the Belt. Site of the Protomolecule incident.

station.name: Tycho Station
station.description: The largest mobile construction platform in the system. Features a massive central sphere and two counter-rotating habitat rings.
station.gmNotes: OPA HQ (Fred Johnson). Currently building the Nauvoo. Can move its orbit.

station.name: Anderson Station
station.description: A lonely cylinder in the outer belt. A key resupply depot for miners.
station.gmNotes: Site of a massacre. Poor ventilation. Gritty industrial aesthetic.

station.name: Thoth Station
station.description: A stealth-composite station hidden in deep space. Hard to detect on sensors.
station.gmNotes: Protogen secret lab. Heavily guarded. The source of the stealth ships.

station.name: Ganymede Ag Domes
station.description: Massive illuminated domes on the surface of Jupiter's largest moon. Mirrors focus sunlight to grow food.
station.gmNotes: The breadbasket of the Belt. Critical strategic resource.

station.name: Phoebe Research Station
station.description: A Protogen facility built into the retrograde moon Phoebe.
station.gmNotes: Source of the Protomolecule. Dangerous. Burned by Mars.

station.name: Lovell City
station.description: A massive subterranean city beneath the lunar regolith. The seat of UN power off-Earth.

habitat.name: O'Neill Cylinder
habitat.description: A massive, self-contained world. A pair of counter-rotating cylinders providing 1G of artificial gravity via spin. Has slow, powerful drives for orbital adjustments.
habitat.gmNotes: A 'city in space.' A major population center, likely with its own government and political intrigue. A target for attack or a safe haven.

habitat.name: Asteroid Base (Ceres-style)
habitat.description: A major habitat and station built *inside* a hollowed-out asteroid, using the asteroid's mass for radiation shielding and spinning it for gravity. No main propulsion.
habitat.gmNotes: A classic 'Belter' or fringe location. Densely populated, maze-like, and full of secrets. The asteroid's rock provides excellent protection from radiation and sensors.

infrastructure.name: Jump Gate
infrastructure.description: A massive, stationary device that generates a stable wormhole or warp corridor to another gate in a different system. No propulsion.
infrastructure.gmNotes: The primary strategic chokepoint in the system. Controlling it means controlling all interstellar trade and travel. A prime military target.

infrastructure.name: Defense Platform
infrastructure.description: A heavily armed, armored, and stealthed weapons platform. Equipped with high-thrust engines for rapid orbital relocation.
infrastructure.gmNotes: A 'stationary dreadnought.' These guard key locations like planets or jump gates. Players might need to sneak past, destroy, or capture one.

infrastructure.name: Jump Point
infrastructure.description: A theoretical stable point in space, allowing ships to enter or exit a warp network. Zero mass, no propulsion.
infrastructure.gmNotes: A critical strategic location. Players will use these for FTL travel. Often guarded or hidden.

anomaly.name: Derelict Freighter
anomaly.description: A cold, silent freighter tumbling on a slow, eccentric orbit. No transponder, no heat. Its main drive is offline and its fuel tanks are empty.
anomaly.gmNotes: The classic 'haunted house' in space. What happened to the crew? What's in the cargo hold? Is it a trap?

ship.name: USS Sulaco
ship.description: A Conestoga-class troop transport ship. Heavily armed and armored, designed to deploy Colonial Marines and dropships to trouble spots.
ship.gmNotes: Carries dropships, APCs, and cryo-sleep pods for marines. Nuclear capable.

ship.name: UD-4L Cheyenne Dropship
ship.description: A tactical utility dropship. Capable of rapid atmospheric entry and VTOL combat operations.
ship.gmNotes: 'In the pipe, five by five.' Can carry an APC. Vulnerable to crashes.

ship.name: USCSS Nostromo
ship.description: A Lockmart CM-88B Bison M-Class starfreighter. Essentially a massive tug designed to haul automated refineries across deep space.
ship.gmNotes: Dark, industrial, dripping water. The refinery it tows is massive (detached here).

ship.name: Ascension Heavy Lifter
ship.description: A shimmering stainless steel tower. This reusable heavy lifter is capable of Single-Stage-To-Orbit with 100t of cargo. Uses 30 massive Methalox Raptors.
ship.gmNotes: The workhorse of the new era. Capable of landing on Mars or Earth.

ship.name: Intra-system Shuttle
ship.description: A small, versatile shuttle for moving personnel and light cargo between planets and stations. Capable of atmospheric flight.
ship.gmNotes: A basic, unexciting 'space van.' Good for getting from A to B, but not for a fight.

ship.name: FTL Explorer (Enterprise-class)
ship.description: A long-range exploratory vessel. Uses an efficient NTR for in-system maneuvering and a warp drive for FTL travel.
ship.gmNotes: A high-tech ship for a 'planet of the week' campaign. Designed for self-sufficiency and exploration.

ship.name: Rocinante (Corvette)
ship.description: Legitimate salvage. A Martian Corvette class. Fast, deadly, and versatile. Capable of atmospheric landing and 10G+ burns.

ship.name: LDSS Nauvoo
ship.description: The largest ship ever built. Intended for a century-long voyage. A self-contained world.
ship.gmNotes: Currently docked at Tycho. Future Medina Station.

ship.name: MCRN Donnager
ship.description: The Martian flagship. A city in space. Carries two corvettes internally.
ship.gmNotes: Patrolling Jupiter. Massive railguns. Increased engines for combat Gs.

ship.name: The Canterbury
ship.description: A retrofitted colony ship hauling ice from Saturn to Ceres. Old and creaky.
ship.gmNotes: Remember the Cant. Low thrust, massive mass.

ship.name: The Razorback
ship.description: A modified pinnace. A fusion torch with seats. Incredible acceleration.
ship.gmNotes: Julie Mao's racer. Hard to catch.

ship.name: MCRN Scirocco
ship.description: A heavy Martian patrol destroyer. Capable of deploying corvettes.

ship.name: The Pella
ship.description: A heavy frigate with cruiser-level armament. Fast, aggressive, and packed with torpedoes.
ship.gmNotes: Free Navy Flagship. Marco Inaros. Hits way above its weight class.

traveller.name: Class A Starport (Highport)
traveller.description: A premier orbital facility serving as the primary interface for interstellar trade. Features a massive shipyard capable of constructing jump-capable starships.
traveller.gmNotes: The commercial hub of the system. Refined fuel, high-end entertainment, and sovereign extraterritoriality.

traveller.name: Class B Starport (Highport)
traveller.description: A comprehensive orbital station capable of building non-jump spacecraft and repairing starships. Lacks the specialized manufacturing for jump drives.
traveller.gmNotes: A solid, industrial station. Good for repairs and trade, but less luxurious than a Class A.

traveller.name: Planetary Downport
traveller.description: A surface-side facility for landing starships. Ranges from extensive tarmac fields (Class C) to rough clearings with a beacon (Class E).
traveller.gmNotes: The interface between the stars and the dirt. Local law level applies here.

traveller.name: Imperial Naval Base
traveller.description: A fortified orbital fortress designed to support the fleet. Heavily shielded and bristling with turret emplacements.
traveller.gmNotes: Restricted airspace. High traffic of patrol cruisers. If the code includes 'D', this is a massive Depot.

traveller.name: IISS Scout Base
traveller.description: A compact, highly sensor-capable outpost for the Imperial Interstellar Scout Service. Often located on the surface or a small moon.
traveller.gmNotes: A hub for couriers and explorers. Excellent maps and sensor data available here. 'S' code.

traveller.name: Way Station
traveller.description: A dedicated refueling and repair depot located on the Xboat network. Essentially a massive gas station in space.
traveller.gmNotes: Fast turnover. 'W' code. Primary function is maintenance of the express boat network.

traveller.name: Research Station
traveller.description: A specialized facility for scientific inquiry. Can range from medical labs to weapons testing or alien archaeology.
traveller.gmNotes: Often secretive ('R' code or implicit). Good dungeon crawl location.

traveller.name: Planetary Military Base
traveller.description: A surface-side fortification housing planetary defense forces, army garrisons, and local militia. Heavily defended against orbital bombardment.
traveller.gmNotes: Code 'M'. Not a starship facility, but a ground force hub. Tanks, mechs, and surface-to-orbit batteries.

traveller.name: Imperial Naval Depot
traveller.description: A massive, sector-level strategic asset. A sprawling complex of shipyards, mothball fleets, and industrial fabricators. 'Death Star' scale importance.
traveller.gmNotes: Code 'D' (Base). These are rare (one per sector). Heavily interdicted. Proceed with extreme caution.

traveller.name: Corsair Base
traveller.description: A hidden, illegal outpost used by raiders and pirates. Often a hollowed-out asteroid or a camouflage-netted moon base.
traveller.gmNotes: Code 'C'. Hidden location. High tech weaponry but poor maintenance. 'Scum and villainy'.

traveller.name: Class D Spaceport
traveller.description: A primitive surface landing site. Features a designated grid and perhaps unrefined fuel, but little else. No repair facilities.
traveller.gmNotes: Code 'D' (Starport). Minimalist. Just flat ground and a fuel pump if you're lucky.

traveller.name: Class E Beacon
traveller.description: A marked landing zone with no facilities whatsoever. A radio beacon indicates the safest approach.
traveller.gmNotes: Code 'E'. 'Frontier' quality. You are on your own.

traveller.name: Hardened Dome City
traveller.description: A settlement protected by massive polarized lead-glass domes and water-jacketed bulkheads.
traveller.gmNotes: Required for M-Star worlds. When a flare hits, blast shutters close, plunging the city into darkness.

traveller.name: Subsurface Arcology
traveller.description: A city built entirely underground to escape surface radiation and temperature extremes.
traveller.gmNotes: Common on Tidally Locked worlds. The surface is a wasteland; life is below.

traveller.name: Hardened Solar Array
traveller.description: Massive photovoltaic fields designed to harvest the intense output of a close-orbit star.
traveller.gmNotes: High output, but vulnerable. Maintenance crews wear heavy rad-suits.
